intro: Cynoglossum coeruleum var. johnstonii, commonly known as Johnston's blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its flowers bloom in late summer, adding a striking visual element to its habitat. This variety is distinguished by its slightly larger leaves and more robust growth compared to the typical form of Cynoglossum coeruleum.
